intro: Telipogon calueri, commonly known as the slender spikerush, is a flowering plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in wet or marshy habitats. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are usually green or reddish in color. It is native to parts of Africa and is often found in swampy areas or along the edges of water bodies. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many regions.
